X.iii.1.A.1.a
.
Definition: Hospitalization
Hospitalization
, as it is used in this section and throughout this chapter, generally refers to inpatient care or treatment that a Veteran receives in a
Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) hospital or medical facility
VA domiciliary
VA nursing home, or
private facility under VA contract.
Notes
:
This contextual usage of the term
hospitalization
does not automatically or inherently imply that the nature of the medical care/treatment administered is consistent with or supports elig
ibility to a temporary 100-percent evaluation under
38 CFR 4.29
or
4.30
.  That determination is contingent on consideration of the individual evidentiary record and procedural principles found in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 8.B
and
C
.
Where specifically stated elsewhere in this chapter, hospital care may be excluded from the term “hospitalization” for adjustment of benefits for Veterans receiving Veteran’s pension after January 31, 1990.
